complaints.summary: VEHICLE EXPERIENCES CONTINUED ELECTRICAL POWER FAILURES CAUSING VEHICLE TO LOOSE ALL ELECTRICAL POWER WHILE DRIVING IN EXCESS OF 50 MPH, UNABLE TO RECTIFY FAILURES.
HEADLIGHTS ILLUMINATE DRIVING SURFACE POORLY CAUSING POOR VISIBILITY.

AUTOMATIC GEAR SHIFT LEVER DOES NOT PERFORM AS STATED IN THE MANUAL, THE THUMB BUTTON DOES NOT NEED TO BE PRESSED TO CHANGE GEARS, THE GEAR MOVED FROM DRIVE TO NEUTRAL WITH JUST A BRUSHING MOVEMENT FORWARD WHILE DRIVING. MJS
NO DEPLOYMENT OF AIR BAG DURING VEHICLE COLLISION, RESULTING IN BACK INJURY TO CONSUMER. MJS
VEHICLE FIRE DUE TO POSSIBLE ENGINE FAILURE.  *MJS

complaints.summary: VEHICLE IS STALLING WHILE CONSUMER IS DRIVING IN HEAVY TRAFFIC.   *SLC
VEHICLE STARTED SMOKING, CONSUMER TOOK THE PROBLEM TO THE DEALER WHO FOUND THAT SOME WIRES HAD MELTED AND MUST HAVE SHORTED SOMETHING OUT.   *SLC
THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM WAS REPLACED.   *CJ
TIRES ROTATED, RIGHT FRONT TIRE PLUGGED AT 18,000 BECAUSE OF SLOW LEAK. *CJ
LOST CONTROL OF VEHICLE AND CRASH. VEHICLE WAS TOTALLED. NOT SURE IF PROBLEM RELATED TO RECALL (00V-075). *CJ

POSSIBLE STEERING FAILURE, VEHICLE SWERVED FROM SIDE TO SIDE OUT OF CONTROL CAUSING INJURY TO CONSUMER, CONSUMER ALSO SUSPECTS POSSIBLE FIRESTONE TIRE FAILURE COULD HAVE CAUSED LOSS OF CONTROL.    *SLC

DURING RECALL REPAIR THE VEHICLE WAS DAMAGED WITH A BROKEN BRAKE LINE AND GREASE WAS REMAINING ALL OVER THE VEHICLE, CONSUMER IS NOT SATISFIED WITH THE DEALERSHIP AND THE RECALL REPAIR (00V-075).   *MJS

WHILE PULLING INTO GARAGE THE CONSUMER COULD NOT GET THE BRAKES TO STOP THE VEHICLE RESULTING IN THE VEHICLE HITTING A FENCE AND DAMAGING THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE, CONSUMER RECIEVED RECALL 00V-075 REGARDING PCRV CORROSION, CONSUMER REQUEST THAT DEALER LOOK AT BRAKES BUT THEY REFUSED TO CHECK THEM UNLESS SHE PAID ALTHOUGH VEHICLE WAS STILL UNDER WARRANTY.  NLM
CONSUMER STATES WHILE DRIVING, VEHICLE LUNGED FORWARD.   *SLC
CONSUMER STATES THAT VEHICLE WENT INTO REVERSE WITHOUT ANY NOTICE.   *SLC
CONSUMER STATES ENGINE LIGHT ILLUMINATES AT ALL TIMES, IT HAS BEEN RESET SEVERAL TIMES.   *SLC
CONSUMER STATES ALL FOUR TIRES WERE REPLACED WITHIN ONLY 6 MONTHS OF PURCHASE, NO SPECIFIC TIRE INFORMATION GIVEN.   *SLC
CONSUMER STATES DASHBOARD WAS COMPLETELY REPLACED DUE TO FALLING APART, REAR SEATBELT BROKE AND IS COMING OUT OF THE SOCKETS.   *SLC

THE DECORATIVE PLASTIC PIECE CAME OFF THE DASHBOARD SHORTLY AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED.  THE DEALER PUT IT BACK,BUT THE PIECE CONTINUED COMING OFF AND IT WAS PUT BACK AGAIN. THE MANUFACTURE WAS NOT HELPFUL TO CORRECT THE DEFECT. *YH   *CB

CONSUMER STATES TRANSMISSION FAILED WITHOUT NO WARNING THAT ANYTHING WAS WRONG, AND THAT MANUFACTURER SHOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE EXPENSES THAT CONSUMER INCURRED DUE TO THE FACT THAT VEHICLE HAD ONLY 37,000 MILES AND IS ONLY TWO YEARS OLD.*JB

SEAT BELT RETRACTORS CONSISTENTLY JAM. THIS MAKES THEM USELESS IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENT. THE DESIGN OF THE FRONT SEATBELT MECHANISM (REGARDLESS OF HOW FAR UP OR BACK THE SEAT IS ADJUSTED) CAUSE THE BELTS TO TWIST AND JAM.  IN ORDER TO UNJAM THEM, YOU MUST STOP THE CAR AND FIGHT WITH THE SEATBELTS. ANY MOVEMENT LOOSENS THEM AND THEY DO NOT RETRACT. IF THERE IS AN ACCIDENT, THE SEATBELTS ARE LIKELY TO CAUSE MORE HARM THAN PROTECTION.
AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY UPON HARD FRONTAL IMPACT WITH OTHER VEHICLE.  *AK

A POTENTIALLY LEATHAL CONDITION EXISTS WITH REGARD TO THE CRUISE CONTROL.THIS SYSTEM HAS NOT  WORKED PROPERLY SINCE PURCHASE OF THE VEHICLE, DESPITE NUMEROUS REPAIRS. ON 9/10/99, DURING HEAVY ACCELERATION(LEFT TURN), THE THROTTLE STUCK WIDE OPEN, ON INVESTIGATION I FOUND THE CRUISE CONTROL CABLE CAUGHT ON THE THROTTLE ARM. APPARENTLY ON WOT CONDITIONS, THE CLIP HOLDING THE CABLE TO THE THROTTLE MAKES CONTACT WITH ITS HOUSING DISCONNECTING THE CABLE FROM THE THROTTLE ARM. THE CABLE THEN HANGS LOOSE IN THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT, CAUSING THE AFORE MENTIONED PROBLEM. FORTUNATELY, THIS IS A MANUAL TRANS. VEHICLE AND I WAS ABLE TO RAPIDLY DISENGAGE THE CLUTCH, AVOIDING ANY SERIOUS INJURY (ALTHOUGH CREATING AN OVER-REV CONDITION).THIS VEHICLE IS EQUIPED WITH TRACTION CONTROL. PLEASE CONTACT ME FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.  *AK
FORTUNATELY I WAS ABLE TO EXTINGUISH FIRE BEFORE IT WAS SERIOUS.  FORD'S CONCERN REGARDING THE INCIDENT IS MINIMAL
NO SUMMARY

I RECENTLY RENTED A 1999 MERCURY CONTOUR AND DROVE IT THROUGH RURAL WESTERN MASS, VERMONT AND NEW HAMPSHIRE BETWEEN DUSK AND DARK, ON INTERSTATE HIGHWAYS. JUST AFTER DUSK I STOPPED TO REFUEL THE CAR. AT THAT POINT THE OVERHEAD DOME LIGHT TURNED ON, AND WOULD NOT TURN OFF.  I DROVE TO THE NEXT REST AREA AND STOPPED TO READ THE OWNER'S MANUAL. IT PROVIDED NO USEFUL INFORMATION ON TURNING OFF THE LIGHT. HOWEVER, WHILE I WAS ALONE IN THE REST AREA READING THE MANUAL IN A CAR LIT UP LIKE A SPOTLIGHT(AND I AM FEMALE), A STRANGE MAN APPROACHED MY CAR FROM BEHIND WITH WHAT I ASSUME WERE BAD INTENTIONS. I THEN DROVE ANOTHER 50 MILES TO A TOTAL OF 7 GAS STATIONS BEFORE I FOUND ONE WITH AN ATTENDANT. HE ALSO HAD NO IDEA HOW TO TURN OFF THE DOME LIGHT.  I THEN HAD TO CHOOSE BETWEEN SPENDING THE NIGHT IN A RENTAL CAR IN A PARKING LIGHT NEAR THE INTERSTATE, OR DRIVNG HOME WITH A LIT DOME LIGHT AND CLOSE TO ZERO VISIBILITY.  AS MY LIFE INSURANCE IS PAID UP, I CHOSE OPTION (B.) AND DROVE HOME.  IT SEEMS TO ME THAT NHTSA SHOULD REQUIRE CAR MANUFACTURERS, AND ESPECIALLY THIS CAR MANUFACTURER, TO SUPPLY ALL INTERIOR LIGHTS WITH A POSITIVE ON-OFF SWITCH.  EITHER THAT, OR SUPPLY LARGE SLEDGE HAMMERS AND A PROMISE OF INDEMNITY FROM CAR RENTAL AGENCIES.  PLEASE LET ME KNOW WHAT YOU WILL DO ABOUT THIS UNSAFE DESIGN FLAW.
IGNORE THIS MESSAGE...TESTING THE SERVER.  *AK

FULL FRONTAL COLLISION WITH A LARGER VEHICLE; REPORTED TO FORD LITIGATION; NO RESPONSE FROM MANUFACTURER. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED IN SUMMARY.  *AK

complaints.summary: I HAVE HAD CAR IN SHOP 4 DIFFERENT TIMES,THEY CHANGED TO ROTORS AND BRAKES THE FIRST TIME AT 3,000 MILES.THEY CLAIM THE ROTORS WERE WARPED FROM THE FACTORY. THE NEXT 2 TIMES THEY CLAIM THE CAR IS FINE,THE LAST TIME ( CAR IS STILL IN THE SHOP SINCE 2/15/00 THIS IS WRITTEN TO YOU 3-09-00) THEY ARE REPLACING THE FRONT ROTORS AND BRAKES AGAIN, THEY SAY THEY ARE REPLACING THE DEFROST SWITCH AND A WIRING HARNESS,THE ENGINE DRIVETRAIN THEY DON'T KNOW???. I HAVE LOST TIME AT WORK AND I DON'T FELL SAFE IN THE CAR. I REFUSE TO TAKE MY "FAMILY" ANYWHERE IN THIS CAR!!!!!.

BOTH FRONT SEAT BELT MECHANISMS FREQUENTLY JAM AND NON-FUNCTIONAL.  ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS I HAVE MANAGED TO FREE THEM WITH TIME AND EFFORT.  THE LAST TIME,  I WAS UNABLE TO UNJAM THE BELT  AND HAD TO LEAVE IT AT THE DEALERSHIP TO BE REPAIRED.     DEALER SAYS FORD DOES NOT WARRANTY SEATBELTS AND I WILL HAVE TO PAY THE INEVITABLE NEXT TIME THIS HAPPENS.  *AK
FRONT END DEFECT CAUSES CAR TO EAT TIRES, UNABLE TO ALIGN OR FIX PROBLEM, CURRENTLY DEALER IS ATTEMPTING SOLUTIONS BUT SO FAR NONE FOUND.  *AK
IT TOOK THREE TRIES TO MY DEALER TO GET THIS FIXED.   I HAVE A RECEIPT IN THERE HANDWRITING STATING THIS FACT.

complaints.component: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:FOUNDATION COMPONENTS:DISC | SUSPENSION:FRONT | VISIBILITY:POWER WINDOW DEVICES AND CONTROLS
complaints.summary: CAR HAS BEEN IN SHOP 1/2 OF TIME OWNED FOR NUMEROUS PROBLEMS.  BRAKE SYSTEM HAD TO BE REPLACED IN FIRST TWO WEEKS AND TOOK COMPANY 4 WEEKS TO "ORDER" PADS AND ROTORS.  ALIGNMENT IS CONSTANTLY OFF, SINCE DAY CAR WAS PICKED UP. TIRES HAVE BEEN REPLACED ONCE SUPPOSSEDLY,ONE IS AGAIN WEARING INCORRECTLY AND HAS VERY LOUD ROAD NOISE. PAINT WAS BUBBLY, CARPET LAID WRONG, NOW POWER WINDOW MAKES HORRIBLE NOISES GOING UP AND DOWN. CAR HAS BEEN MORE OF A PAIN THAN ANYTHING I EVER BOUGHT. *AK

DRIVERS SIDE DOOR GLASS EXPLODED FOR NO APPARENT REASON. NOT HIT BY ANY OBJECT. AIR CONDITIONING ON. OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE 80F. LAST DRIVEN 3 HOURS BEFORE. LETTER SENT TO FORD (COPY AVAILABLE ON REQUEST) STATING MY BELIEF THAT GLASS WAS DEFECTIVE. FORD RESPONDED THAT THEY WEREN'T RESPONSIBLE FOR EXPLODING GLASS, THAT IT WAS BETWEEN ME & MY INSURANCE CO. THIS WAS AN ALMOST NEW CAR WHICH WAS NOT EXPOSED TO REPEATED CYCLES OF HOT WEATHER NOR WAS IT HIT BY ANYTHING. I BELIEVE A POTENTIAL PRODUCT DEFECT EXISTS.

THIS CAR HAS BEEN DEFECTIVE SINCE THE DAY I BOUGHT IT 10-2-99 WITH O5 MILES ON IT. I'VE HAD IT IN THE DEALERS SHOP AND THEY AGREE THERE IS A PROBLEM THEY CANNOT SOLVE,BUT NOE THEY WON'T EVEN WORK ON IT ANYMORE AND HAV MADE THE STATEMENT" WE HAVE PUT TOO MUCH MONEY IN IT ALREADY" I'VE SPOKEN TO MANAGERS AND CONTACTED FORD MOTOR COMPANY TWICE BY PHONE THE RESPONSE WAS TO GIVE THE DEALER TWO BUSSINESS DAYS TO LET ME KNOW WHAT THEY ARE GOING TO DO.MY LOANER CAR AND APPOINTMENT FOR THE FORD MOTOR COMPANY TO REVIEW MY CAR IS 7-27-00. THIS CAR IS A LEMON I FEEL SHOULD BE TAKEN OFF THE ROAD, IM AFRAID IT COULD ENDANGER SOMEONE NOT KNOWING WHAT IS EVEN WRONG WITH IT ,WHAT SYSTEM OR ANYTHING. CAN YOU HAVE ANY INPUT IN THIS SITUATION, I HAVE A DISABLED CHILD IN A WHEELCHAIR AND DEPEND SOLELY ON THIS CAR FOR HIS HEALTH AND SPECIALIST APPTS. THIS CAR IS A NESSESSSITY NOT A LUXURY. THANKYOU SINCERELY, VIRGINIA SMITH.  NO SAFETY DEFECT DISCUSSED IN SUMMARY.  *AK

complaints.component: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:ENGINE:GASOLINE | STEERING:GEAR BOX (OTHER THAN RACK AND PINION) | SUSPENSION:FRONT
complaints.summary: REPEATED STALLING, MISSING & LOSS OF POWER APPEARS MOSTLY WHEN IT'S VERY HOT OUT & CAR HAS BEEN DRIVEN A LOT.  ROUGH IDLE EVEN UNDER NO LOAD IN NEUTRAL. NO INDICATORS LIGHT EXCEPT DURING STALL WHICH HAPPENS EVEN WITH CLUTCH DEPRESSED.  MISSING IS MOST NOTICEABLE DURING ACCELERATION OR STEADY HIGHWAY SPEEDS, EVEN WITH CRUISE ON.  CAR SOMETIMES SHAKES AT HIGH SPEED (70MPH).  MULTIPLE ALIGNMENTS NEVER SHOW SAME RESULTS.  DEALER CAN NEVER DUPLICATE, SAYS I AM DUMPING CLUTCH TO STALL & LOSS OF POWER IS DUE TO A/C.  THEY ALSO CLAIM EXCESSIVE TIRE WEAR IS DUE TO MY DRIVING HABITS.  *AK( DOT NUMBER:   )

complaints.summary: SINCE 12-15-99 I HAD COUGAR IN SERVICE 3 TIMES FOR WATER LEAK/ 2 TIMES SHIFT LOCK ,LOCKED DOWN BECAUSE OF BRAKE LIGHT FAILURE HAVE COMPLAINED ABOUT REAR BRAKE ELCO NOISE WHEN BACKING UP/ CAR HESITATING AT 50+ MILES AN HOUR /PULLING TO RIGHT WHEN PASSING AND GIVING THE CAR MORE ACCELERATION/CAR IDLING REAL HIGH AND WANTING TO TAKE OFF WHEN YOU FIRST RELEASE THE BRAKE/ THE WINDOWS NOT GOING UP AND DOWN / THE BATTERY EXPLODED/ THE SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE AT  GATEWAY THE NOISE IS STILL IN THE REAR WHEELS . THERE IS MORE WHERE THIS CAME FROM THE COUGAR WILL FALL APART/ THE ENGINE OR TRANSMISSION IS A PROBLEM . *AK( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: P/215/S0R1 )

TOTAL STEERING LOSS,ON SLIGHT CURVED RD. TOTAL RIGHT WHEEL AND EVERYTHING ATTACHED CAME OFF. EVEN THE COLLISION REPAIR SHOP SAID THEY NEVER SAW ANYTHING LIKE THAT.  I AM SUSAN CANALES AND HAVE MY SON'S POWER OF ATTORNEY HE IS IN THE NAVY AND AT SEA RIGHT NOW THANK YOU.  *AK

I WROTE A LETTER TO FORD (DATED AUGUST 18) LETTING THEM KNOW THAT I WAS NOT HAPPY ABOUT HAVING TO PAY  OVER $700 FOR AN ALTERNATOR (WHICH WAS SUPPOSEDLY ONLY 1 YEAR OLD) AND AN AIR FLOW SENSOR. I BOUGHT THE CAR USED IN JUNE 1999 AND DIDN'T FEEL THAT I SHOULD BE REPLACING EITHER AFTER ONLY A YEAR. PLEASE SEE LETTER ATTACHED. THIS MORNING (10/17/00), MY CAR WOULDN'T START UNTIL I PUT IT IN NEUTRAL.*AK
THESE TIRES ARE AN ACCIDENT WAITING TO HAPPEN.  *AK

INSIDE TIRE WALL BLEW.  NOISE LIKE AN EXPLOSION.  NO ROAD HAZARD HIT DURING HISTORY OF CAR.  MANUFACTURER SAID DAMAGE HAD TO BE CAUSED BY ROAD HAZARD SINCE A DEFECTIVE TIRE NEVER LEAVES THEIR PLANT.  THEY WERE NOT HELPFUL.*AK (TIRESIZE: 215/50ZR16)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 215/50ZR16 )

MY VEHICLE HAS A DESIGN FLAW.  THE VEHICLES STALLS AFTER SPLASHING THROUGH WATER.  ONLY 1-2 INCHES ARE NECESSARY TO CAUSE A STALL.  ALSO, THE VEHICLE STALL WHEN TURNING IN THE RAIN.  THE ENGINE WILL SQUEAL, THE ALTERNATOR LIGHT WILL COME ON, AND THE VEHICLE WILL BECOME VERY DIFFICULT TO STOP AND STEER DUE TO LOSS OF ELECTRICAL POWER.  THIS PROBLEM WAS IDENTIFED IN FORD'S TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN # TSB 97-11-2.  THIS DESIGN FLAW IS ONLY SUPPOSED TO AFFECT 1995-1998 CONTOURS.  HOWEVER, IT MUST BE NOTED THAT MY CONTOUR IS AN EARLY 1999 (MANUFACTURED IN SEPTEMBER 1998).  THE TSB DESCRIBES THAT THE VEHICLES NEEDS TO HAVE A SPLASH GUARD INSTALLED.  REPEATED REQUESTS TO FORD MOTOR COMPANY HAVE NOT LEAD TO ANY ACTION BEING TAKEN.  I BELIEVE THAT MY VEHICLE IS DANGEROUS TO DRIVE THROUGH ANY AMOUNT OF ACCUMULATED WATER.  ITS TENDENCY TO STALL FORCES ME TO DRIVE THROUGH PUDDLES VERY SLOWLY WHICH CREATES A DANGEROUS SITUATION FOR VEHICLES AROUND ME.  I BELIEVE THAT FORD SHOULD FIX THIS DESIGN DEFECT FREE OF CHARGE (LABOR AND PARTS).  I WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE ANY ASSISTANCE THAT YOUR AGENCY COULD PROVIDE.

I HAVE HAD THIS VIBRATION AS FAR BACK AS THE ORIGINAL TIRES. I PAID FOR A BALANCE AND ALIGNMENT DUE TO UNUSUAL TIRE WEAR. THE FORD DEALERSHIP CHARGED ME $87 FOR THE SERVICE. I WAS INFORMED IN WRITING THAT I HAD DEFECTIVE TIRES AND WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO FIX THE VIBRATION UNTIL I REPLACED THE TIRE. ONCE I REPLACED THE TIRES $339.96. I STILL HAD THE VIBRATION. I TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE FORD DEALER AND I WAS INFORMED IN WRITING THAT I HAD 2 DEFECTIVE TIRES. I TOOK IT BACK TO THE STORE THAT I PURCHASED THE TIRES FROM AND ENDED UP UPGRADING TO A MORE EXPENSIVE TIRE SINCE THE COULD NOT REMEDY THE PROBLEM. (COST $67.52)I WENT BACK TO THE FORD DEALER AND THEY ROLLED UP 517 MILES ON MY VEHICLE AND INFORMED ME THAT I HAD A DEFECT THAT COULD NOT BE FIXED. THEY SHOWED ME A SERVICE BULLETING FROM FORD THAT STATED A PROCEDURE TO FOLLOW AND THEN STOP EVEN IF THE VIBRATION WAS NOT ELIMINATED. I CONTACTED FORD CUSTOMER SERVICE AND THEY ASKED ME TO RETURN TO THE DEALERSHIP FOR ANOTHER TRY. ANOTHER 400-500 MILES WERE ROLLED UP ON MY CAR AND THE PROBLEM STILL EXISTS. I CONTACTED FORD SERVICE AGAIN AND THEY ARE SENDING ME BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP. WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON?  IF MY TIRES FAIL OR I HAVE ANOTHER FAILURE, WHO IS GOING TO COVER MY COSTS AND BE LIABLE. WHO IS GOING TO COVER THE EXPENSES HAVE ALREADY INCURRED?*AK (TIRESIZE: 205/60R15)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 205/60R15 )
I FEEL THAT THERE SHOULD BE A RECALL ON THE STANDARD TRANSMISSIONS BY FORD BECAUSE THERE IS DEFENITELY SOMETHING DEFECTIVE WITH THIS TRANSMISSION.*AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK (TIRESIZE: 2056015T)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 2056015T )

WE WERE DRIVING (ONE MILE FROM HOME) WHEN IT SOUNDED LIKE WE HAD A FLAT TIRE. I PULLED OVER AND CHECKED. TIRES WERE FINE. HEARD THUMPING AGAIN. TURNED CAR AROUND BECAUSE OF 87 YEAR OLD FATHER IN VEHICLE. SMOKE CAME THROUGH THE VENTS. I PULLED INTO THE DRIVEWAY. SMOKE CAME OUT FROM UNDER HOOD. HUSBAND WAS DOING YARD WORK. MY SON ADAM YELLED THAT THERE WERE FLAMES. MY HUSBAND RAN TO THE GARAGE AND GOT A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. PUT FIRE OUT. HAD TO CUT TWO WIRES TO STOP THE SMOKING AND SIZZLING. CONTACTED STATE FARM. A FIRE INVESTIGATOR SAID HE BELIEVES THAT THE WAY THE WIRES WERE ROUTED ONTO THE FIRE WALL, RUBBED AGAINST A SCREW THAT WAS STICKING OUT OF THE FIRE WALL AND OVER TIME WORE THE WIRE, CAUSING A FIRE.*AK

complaints.component: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:IGNITION | EXTERIOR LIGHTING:HEADLIGHTS | POWER TRAIN:AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION | POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:CONSTANT VELOCITY JOINT | SEATS | SUSPENSION:FRONT | TIRES
complaints.summary: PROBLEMS STARTED AT 119MILES, DEALERS EITHER DON'T CONFIRM PROBLEM OR SAY IT'S NORMAL FOR THIS CAR. MULTIPLE REPAIR ATTEMPTS AT 4 DEALERS. SEVERE VIBRATION AND PULL AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS ARE THE TIRES (CONFIRED WITH MY WINTER TIRES-NO PROBLEM), KLUNKING FROM FRONT END WHEN GOING OVER BUMPS, ALL DASH WARNING LIGHTS COME ON DURING WINTER AT IDLE-GO OUT AFTER RESTART OR ENGINE ACCELERATION, FRONT SEATS WOBBLE SIDE TO SIDE-DEALER SAYS NORMAL FOR CAR-WAN'T PRESENT WHEN NEW, PULSING FRONT END SHIMMY ON HIGHWAY-NOT TIRE RELATED-POSSIBLE CV SHAFT ISSUE-DEALERS STATED NPF, ENGINE SPARK KNOCKS UNDER LIGHT LOADS-NO CHANGE WITH DIFFERENT GAS GRADES OR BRANDS-DEALERS SAYS NPF, HEADLAMPS GO DIM AT IDLE-DEALERS SAYS NORMAL-NOT PRESENT WHEN NEW, POOR LOW BEAM VISIBILITY FROM HEADLAMPS, ALUMINUM WHEELS ARE TOO POROUS-LOSE ABNORMAL AIR AMOUNTS-DEALER SAYS NPF. MOST OF THESE HAVE BEEN SINCE NEW OR STARTED WITHIN 1ST YEAR OF NEW- NO DEALERS HAS YET "CONFIRMED" PROBLEMS WHEN THEY ARE READILY APPARENT TO OTHERS. IN SHOP FOR OVER 3 MONTHS TOTAL SINCE NEW.  *AK (TIRESIZE: P205/60R15)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: P205/60R15 )

THE DEALERSHIP ADMITED THAT A TECHNICIAN LEFT A WIRE LOOSE WHEN THEY INSTALLED A NEW MOTOR IN MY CAR.  THEY WERE REPAIRING ALL DAMAGE DUE TO THE FIRE.  THEY DID NOT.  MY SON HAD AN ACCIDENT 4 MONTHS LATER.  WHEN THE AIRBAGS DEPLOYED, THE PASSANGER SIDE AIRBAG WAS BURNT AND MELTED, THEREFORE NEVER COMPLETELY DEPLOYING.

MY CONTOUR CONTINUES TO STALL WHILE DRIVING. I WAS FIRST TOLD BY DEALER SERVICE THAT IT WAS THE FUEL PUMP, THEN THE FUEL FILTER, AND FINALLY THAT IT WAS A SENSOR. THIS VEHICLE SEEMS TO STALL WHEN MY GAS GAUGE IS CLOSE TO A QUARTER TANK OF GAS. I JUST GOT THIS CAR OUT OF THE SERVICE DEPT. 4 DAYS AGO, NOW IT IS STILL STALLING AND THE ENGINE LIGHT IS ON. *AK
IN ADDITION TO THE OTHER DEFECTS I HAVE LISTED ON THE QUESTIONAIRE, MY VEHICLE OCCASIONALLY DOES NOT GO INTO FORWARD GEAR, AND THEN VIOLENTLY JERKS INTO GEAR.*AK

complaints.component: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:COOLING SYSTEM | ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:ENGINE:GASOLINE | FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:FUEL INJECTION SYSTEM | SUSPENSION:FRONT | VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL | VISIBILITY:DEFROSTER/DEFOGGER/HVAC SYSTEM
complaints.summary: WITHIN 6 MONTHS OF THE PURCHASE OF MY VEHICLE, THE CAR STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WITH VIBRATIONS, SHAKING, AND SEVERE NOISE WHILE DRIVING.  THE ENGINE IDLED ROUGH AND GOT MORE SEVERE WHEN THE HEATING OR COOLING SYSTEM WAS USED.  ALL TIRES HAVE BEEN REPLACED, A MAJOR BRAKE JOB WITH ROTORS TURNED WAS COMPLETED, AND THE STRUTS WERE REPLACED.  REGARDLESS OF THIS WORK, THE SHAKING IN THE CAR HAS GOTTEN PROGRESSIVELY WORSE.  I HAVE TAKEN MY CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP FIVE TIMES FOR THE SAME PROBLEMS.  THEY HAVE EITHER SAID THAT IT WAS "NORMAL CONTOUR" OR THAT IT WAS THE TIRES.  FINALLY, THEY INDICATE THAT THERE IS A PROBLEM BUT THEY CANNOT DETERMINE WHAT IT IS.  MY CAR MAKES A THUMPING NOISE AND A SQUEALING NOISE WHEN I MAKE SLOW RIGHT TURNS.  ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS MY FOOT HAS BEEN ON THE BRAKE PEDAL AND MY CAR SURGED FORWARD.  AT ONE POINT I THOUGHT THAT THE PERSON BEHIND ME HAD HIT ME BECAUSE THE CAR JERKED SO HARD AND SO UNEXPECTEDLY.  AGAIN, I AM TOLD THAT THIS IS NORMAL.  THIS IS THE WORST CAR THAT I HAVE EVER OWNED. *AK
HEATER CONTROL SWITCH WILL NOT WORK ON NORMAL SETTING BUT WILL ONLY WORK IF YOU PUT IT ON HIGH AND THAT IS RESULTING IN THE LOSS OF POWER OR DECREASING POWER IN THE ALTERNATOR. *AK

complaints.component: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING:INTERIOR/UNDER DASH | STRUCTURE:BODY | VISIBILITY:DEFROSTER/DEFOGGER/HVAC SYSTEM:WINDSHIELD:ELECTRICAL HEATING ELEMENT | VISIBILITY:GLASS, SIDE/REAR
complaints.summary: SAID CAR HAD DEFECTS ALMOST AS SOON AS WE PURCHASED IT, WE NOTICED IT HAD 2 DIFFERENT EMBLAMS ON THE FENDERS AND THEY HAD TO RUN THE VIN# SO THEY COULD FIND OUT WHICH IT WAS.  THE CAR STARTED LEAKING WITHIN 6 MONTHS OF PURCHASE, THEY WORKED ON IT 3 TIMES TO NO PREVAIL(STILL LEAKS)  THE DASH HAS BOWED UP AT THE WINDSHIELD  AND AT THE PANEL BEHIND THE STEERING WHEEL, INSTRUMENT PANEL HAS SMOKED UP, HEATER SWITCH ONLY WORKS ON HIGH SETTING, PASS. SIDE FRONT WINDOW FELL OUT OF DOOR TRACK WHILE GOING DOWN THE HIGHWAY, SPEAKER BUSTED, CARPET RUINED BECAUSE OF LEAKS.  BLANCETTS HAD ALL OF THESE PARTS ORDERED FOR OVER 6 MONTHS AND THEY STILL DID NOT GET ALL OF THEM IN, AN D FORD MOTOR COMPANY HAS CLOSED THEM DOWN. I DON'T KNOW THE SPECIFICS OF THE REASONS FOR CLOSING THEM, BUT THEY HAD TROUBLE ONCE OR TWICE WITH GETTING CARS AND TRUCKS WITH MILEAGE ROLLBACK PROBLEMS.
THIS TIRE WAS ALWAYS PROPERLY MAINTAINED, AND HAD NOT BEEN ABUSED. IT FAILED WITH LITTLE WARNING.  MAYBE 5 TO 10 SECONDS OF VIBRATION PRIO TO FAILING.*AK (DOT NUMBER: UNKOWN  TIRESIZE: P18570R14)

complaints.component: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING:INTERIOR/UNDER DASH | EQUIPMENT:ELECTRICAL:RADIO/TAPE DECK/CD ETC. | VISIBILITY:DEFROSTER/DEFOGGER/HVAC SYSTEM:WINDSHIELD:ELECTRICAL HEATING ELEMENT | VISIBILITY:WINDSHIELD
complaints.summary: OUR CAR HAS HAD PROBLEMS SINCE DAY ONE WE HAVE 2 DIFFERENT EMBLAMS ON THE FENDERS, WINDOW FELL OUT, SPEAKERS BUSTED, CARPET RUINED BY LEAKS, FAN SWITCH ONLY WORKS ON HIGH SETTING, INSTRUMENT PANEL SMOKED UP AS IF BURNING, HOOD DOESN'T MEET UP WITH COWL, TRUNK STAYS SOAKED, AND THERE ARE NUMEROUS OTHER PROBLEMS ALL HAPPENED WITHIN SIX MONTHS OF ORIGINAL PURCHASE.  *AK

THE DASHBOARD IS COMING OFF.  AS IT IS COMING OFF IT IS CURLING UP AND I AM AFRAID IT IS GOING TO GET IN THE WAY OF MY VISION AS I AM DRIVING.  IT IS A '1999 AND I FEEL LIKE IT SHOULD NOT BE COMING APART LIKE THAT.*AK

complaints.component: POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DIFFERENTIAL UNIT | UNKNOWN OR OTHER
complaints.summary: I TOOK CAR BACK THE NEXT MORNING AFTER PURCHASE, DEALER CLAIMS THERE IS NOTHING HE CAN DO, THE ENGINE LIGHT HAS BEEN ON SINCE DAY ONE AND I HAVE TAKEN IT BACK TWICE, THEY REPLACED THE DIFFERENTIAL SENSOR, IT WENT OFF FOR ABOUT 10 MINS AND HAS BEEN ON EVER SINCE. NOW EVERYTHING ELSE SEEMS TO BE GOING WRONG WITH THIS CAR.

THE PASSENGER SIDE SEAT BELT LOCKED WHILE I WAS DRIVING ON THE INTERSTATE. THE ECOND TIME, IT JUST WOULD NOT RELEASE, AND I HAD TO CUT THE SEATBEAT SO THE PASSENGER COULD GET OUT.   AIR CONDITIONER BLOWER SWITCH JUST WENT OUT ONE DAY. THE AIR CONDITIONER WILL ONLY WORK IF I KEEP THE CONTROL TURNED TO "HIGH." I WOULD LIKE TO HAVE BOTH OF THESE ITEMS REPLACED BY FORD, IF POSSIBLE. "*AK
REPLACEMENT BRAKE ROTORS WAS ONLY THREE WEEKS OLD.  ROTORS SEPARATED, DID NOT RETREIVE BROKEN ITEM FROM REPAIR SHOP.
I WANT TO KNOW IF THIS IS A RECALL. NO SAFETY DEFEC TMENTIONED.  *AK
ENGINE MOUNTS ON BOTH SIDES ARE BROKEN.*AK

THE FRONT DASH ON MY 99 FORD CONTOUR HAS PULLED AWAY FROM THE FRONT WINDSHIELD CAUSING THE DEFROSTER PANEL TO POP OUT WHILE DRIVING.  THE DEFROSTER PANEL HAS POPPED OUT AND BLOCKED MY VIEW CAUSING ME TO HAVE TWO NEAR INCIDENTS INVOLVING OTHER VEHICLES.  I CALLED FORD MOTOR COMPANY (REF# 900850990) AND WAS TOLD BY THEIR REPRESENTATIVE THAT FORD DID HAVE A CUSTOMER SATISFACTION PROGRAM ON THIS PART, BUT THAT THE PROGRAM HAD EXPIRED.  I RECIEVED NO NOTICE AND NOW FORD MOTOR COMPANY IS REFUSING TO REPAIR MY VEHICLE DUE TO THE PROGRAM EXPIRING.  PLEASE INVESTIGATE AND ADVISE ME IF I HAVE ANY OTHER RECOURSE.  DT
REFUND DOWN PAYMENT AND KEEP THE CAR.   MR

complaints.component: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:FOUNDATION COMPONENTS:HOSES, LINES/PIPING, AND FITTINGS
complaints.summary: DO TO IMPROPER LOCATING THE RUBBER ON THE BRAKE LINE UNUSUAL WEAR TO RUBBER BRAKE LINE. HAVE PICTURE.  DT
THE DASH IS CURLED UP IN THE FRONT. THE INTERIOR TRIM PEICE THAT GOES AROUND THE DEFROSTER VENT HAS POPPED OUT OF PLACE.    MR
THE CONSUMER HAS TO CONSTANTLY UNJAM OR UNTWIST THE SEATBELTS TO BE ABLE TO PULL OUT OR RETACT PROPERLY TO BUCKLE OR UNBUCKLE.  *MJS
THE BRAKES MAKE A CONSTANT GRINDING NOISE AND MOSTLY WHEN THE CAR IS HEATED, THE DEALER STATES THIS IS NORMAL.  *MJS
SEAT BELT FAILS TO RETRACT WHEN UNBUCKLING THE BELT AND EXITING THE VEHICLE, CONSUMER STATES IT'S HAPPENED DAILY FOR 2 MONTHS.   *SLC

complaints.component: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK/TRACTION CONTROL/ELECTRONIC LIMITED SLIP
complaints.summary: WHENEVER BRAKE ARE APPLIED THEY CAUSE A CRACKING SOUND. DEALER NOTIFIED AND NFORMED  CONSUMER  THAT IT WAS NORMAL FOR THAT VEHICLE. SEEKING HELP OR ADDITIONAL INFORMATON FROM NHTSA IN THIS MATTER.  *AK

complaints.component: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK/TRACTION CONTROL/ELECTRONIC LIMITED SLIP | STEERING: STEERING WHEEL/HANDLE BAR | SUSPENSION:FRONT | TIRES
complaints.summary: BRAKES WOULD MAKE GRINDING NOISES WHEN APPLIED. THE TIRES ARE GOING BALD.  STEERING WHEEL FEELS REAL LOOSE WHN GOING OVER BUMPS OR TURNING. THE FRONT END SUSPENSION WOULD JERK & PULL TO THE LEFT. WILL BE CONTACTING DEALER TO HAVE VEHICLE CHECKED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 55MP REAR SIDE DRIVER'S WINDOW SHATTERED. NOTHING HIT THE WINDSHIELD.CONTACTED THE DEALER.  *AK
WHEN BRAKES WERE APPLIED  VEHICLE MADE A GRINDING NOISE. DEALER SAID VEHICLE NEEDED NEW  BRAKE PADS. *AK

GOING APPROX 30MPH & SWERVED TO AVOID HITTING A CAT. LEFT FRONT WHEEL HIT CURB & BOTH AIR BAGSS POPPED OUT & QUICKLY DEFLATED. BROKE WINDSHIELD. WAS ABLE TO STUFF AIR BAGS BACK IN. WILL BE TAKING VEHICLE TO DEALER TO CHECK & CORRECT AIR BAGS.
JACK THAT COMES EQUIPPED WITH VEHICLE IS TOO SHORT , WILL NOT PICK UP VEHICLE ENOUGH TO ACTUALLY TAKE OFF THE TIRE, CAUSING VEHICLE TO SLIP OFF JACK.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD  STEERING COLUMN JUST LOCKED UP.CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED DEALER.  *AK
DRIVER'S SIDE AND PASSENGER'S SIDE AUTOMATIC SHOULDER BELTS WILL NOT RETRACT AND LOCK, CAUSING LOSS  OF PROTECTION.  *AK
WHILE SITTING IN THE VEHICLE AT A LIGHT ANOTHER VEHICLE REAR ENDED  CONSUMER'S VEHICLE, AND DIVER'S/ PASSENGER'S SEAT BELTS  BROKE.  *AK
HORN IS INOPERABLE. THE DEALER HAS INSPECTED THE VEHICLE.  *AK
INTERMITTENT STALLING;   THIS WAS THE FOURTH TIME THIS HAS HAPPENED.   CONTACTED DEALER , AND HE WAS NOT ABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE. *AK

complaints.component: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK/TRACTION CONTROL/ELECTRONIC LIMITED SLIP
complaints.summary: ONGOING PROBLEM WITH VIBRATION WHENEVER BRAKES ARE APPLIED. VEHICLE BEEN INSPECTED / REPAIRED ON THREE OCCASIONS.  ALSO,  REPLACED ROTORS/PADS, AND REAR DRUMS. BUT PROBLEM STILL REOCCURRING. SEEKING HELP FROM NHTSA IN THIS MATTER.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING AT 35 MPH THE VEHICLE WAS HIT BY ANOTHER VEHICLE. HOWEVER, DURING THE COLLISION THE PASSENGER SIDE SHOULDER BELT BROKE CAUSING PASSENGER TO HIT THE WINDSHIELD. THE PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG DEPLOYED, CAUSING AIRBAG TO HIT PASSENGER IN THE FACE.   *YC
FRONT SEAT BELT RETRACTORS DO NOT RETRACT FOR USE OR AFTER USE. WOULD BE VERY LIMP IN LAP.  BELTS GET TWISTED WHILE RETRACTING, BUT NOT COMPLETELY. TAKING VEHICLE TO DEALER TO CHECK BELTS OUT.  *AK
IN ORDER TO USE THE HORN EXCESSIVE PRESSURE HAS TO BE APPLIED TO MAKE IT WORK. SOMETIMES IT DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. DEALER HAS REPLACED THE CONTACTS AND PROBLEM STILL EXISTS.  *AK

VEHICLE  HAS BEEN IN REPAIR SHOP FIVE TIMES.  WHEN TRAVELING  VEHICLE WOULD CUT OFF  AT ANY SPEED.  THE FIRST TIME AT REPAIR SHOP THEY TOLD CONSUMER THAT  IT WAS THE FUEL PUMP.  SECOND TIME, CONSUMER WAS INFORMED, THAT  THEY HAD NO IDEA WHAT WAS WRONG WITH  VEHICLE. HOWEVER,  THE THIRD TIME CONSUMER WAS TOLD IT WAS  FUEL PUMP SENSOR.   VEHICLE IS CURRENTLY IN  REPAIR SHOP. *AK
WHEN THE BRAKES ARE APPLIED VEHICLE VIBRATES.   DEALER HAS REPLACED THE ROTORS.*AK
BOTH FRONT SEAT BELTS WOULD GET TANGLED UP AND WOULD NOT RETRACT. DEALER NOTIFIED, HAD BOTH BELTS REPLACED ON TWO OCCASIONS, PROBLEM  STILL REOCCURRING. *AK *ML

ONGOING / INTERMITTENT PROBLEM WITH VEHICLE EXPERIENCING STALLING  WHILE DRIVING AT HIGHWAY SPEED OF 65-70 MPH. VEHICLE BEEN IN/OUT OF DEALER SHOP ON THREE OCCASIONS, AND PROBLEM STILL REOCURRING.  *AK

WHEN DRIVING AT ANY TIME VEHICLE CUTS OFF WITHOUT PRIOR WARNING, CAUSING LOSS OF ALL POWER. CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED THE DEALER, DEALER UNABLE TO DETERMINE  CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.*AK
WHILE DRIVING  CONSUMER  WOULD FEEL BRAKES RUBBING AND GRINDING. TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER, AND THEY TURNED THE ROTORS.  BUT,  PROBLEM HAS REOCCURRED. *AK
LOW BEAM HEADLIGHT HAS POOR AND INSUFFICIENT LIGHTING, CAUSING POOR VISIBILITY.  *AK

complaints.component: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:ENGINE:GASOLINE | INTERIOR LIGHTING | STEERING: STEERING WHEEL/HANDLE BAR
complaints.summary: WHILE DRIVING ON HIGHWAY TRAVELLING 70MPH,  EXITED OFF THE FREEWAY AND BEGAN TO BRAKE WHEN ENGINE CUT OFF. ALSO,  INSTRUMENT  LIGHTS CAME ON, AND THE STEERING WHEEL LOCKED UP AND WAS UNABLE TO TURN.  ENGINE TURNED BACK ON, AND WAS ABLE TO REGAIN CONTROL OF VEHICLE.  *AK

HORN HAS  NOT WORKED PROPERLY.   VEHICLE HAS BEEN TAKEN TO THE DEALER ON 3 DIFFERENT OCCASIONS.  DEALER HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM.   HORN HAS BEEN REPLACED BY DEALER, BUT PROBLEM STILL OCCURS.  *AK

recalls.consequence: IF BOTH PCRV'S MALFUNCTION, VEHICLE HANDLING COULD BE ADVERSELY AFFECTED DURING BRAKING AS A RESULT OF THE REAR WHEELS LOCKING, INCREASING THE RISK OF A CRASH.
recalls.remedy: DEALERS WILL INSTALL IMPROVED PCRV'S IN THE REAR BRAKE SYSTEM.  THIS RECALL WAS EXPANDED IN SEPTEMBER 2000 TO INCLUDE 1999 AND 2000 FORD CONTOUR, MERCURY MYSTIQUE AND COUGAR VEHICLES.
recalls.summary: VEHICLE DESCRIPTION:  PASSENGER VEHICLES NOT EQUIPPED WITH THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKING SYSTEM (ABS).  A PRESSURE CONSCIOUS REDUCING VALVE (PCRV) IN THE REAR BRAKES MAY BE SUBJECT TO CORROSION AND RESULT IN MALFUNCTION, WHEN OPERATED IN AREAS THAT USE SALT COMPOUNDS ON THE ROADWAY FOR DE-ICING OR DUST CONTROL.
recalls.notes: OWNER NOTIFICATION BEGAN APRIL 3, 2000 FOR THE 1996-1998 MODEL VEHICLES AND ON OCTOBER 11, 2000, FOR THE 1999-2000 MODEL VEHICLES.    OWNERS WHO TAKE THEIR VEHICLES TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER ON AN AGREED UPON SERVICE DATE AND DO NOT RECEIVE THE FREE REMEDY WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME SHOULD CONTACT FORD AT 1-800-392-3673.   ALSO CONTACT THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION'S AUTO SAFETY HOTLINE AT 1-888-DASH-2-DOT (1-888-327-4236).

recalls.consequence: IF THE GROMMET IS DAMAGED, FUEL COULD LEAK.   FUEL LEAKAGE IN THE PRESENCE OF AN IGNITION SOURCE COULD RESULT IN A FIRE.
recalls.remedy: DEALERS WILL REPLACE THE FUEL TANK FILLER PIPE GROMMET.
recalls.summary: VEHICLE DESCRIPTION:  BI-FUEL VEHICLES.  THESE VEHICLES MAY HAVE A FUEL TANK FILLER PIPE GROMMET THAT COULD HAVE BEEN DAMAGED DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE BI-FUEL SYSTEM.  IF THE GROMMET IS DAMAGED, FUEL COULD LEAK.   FUEL LEAKAGE IN THE PRESENCE OF AN IGNITION SOURCE COULD RESULT IN A FIRE.  DEALERS WILL REPLACE THE FUEL TANK FILLER PIPE GROMMET.
recalls.notes: OWNER NOTIFICATION BEGAN NOVEMBER 30, 2000.  OWNERS WHO TAKE THEIR VEHICLES TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER ON AN AGREED UPON SERVICE DATE AND DO NOT RECEIVE THE FREE REMEDY WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME SHOULD CONTACT FORD AT 1-800-392-3673.    ALSO CONTACT THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION'S AUTO SAFETY HOTLINE AT 1-888-DASH-2-DOT (1-888-327-4236).

recalls.consequence: LOSS OF BRAKE FLUID CAN LEAD TO A DECREASE IN BRAKE LINE PRESSURE AND AN INCREASE IN STOPPING DISTANCE, WHICH CAN RESULT IN A VEHICLE CRASH.
recalls.remedy: AFFINIA (BRAKE PARTS, INC.) WILL REPLACE THE SUBJECT BRAKE HYDRAULIC MASTER CYLINDERS FREE OF CHARGE.  THE RECALL BEGAN ON MARCH 20, 2006.  OWNERS CAN CONTACT AFFINA GROUP CUSTOMER SERVICE AT 1-800-323-0354.
recalls.summary: CERTAIN AFTERMARKET BRAKE HYDRAULIC MASTER CYLINDERS SOLD AS REPLACEMENT BRAKE CYLINDERS FOR CERTAIN FORD, DAIMLERCHRYSLER, AND JEEP PASSENGER VEHICLES.  THESE BRAKE CYLINDERS WERE SOLD UNDER THE BRAND NAMES OF NAPA, RAYBESTOS, AIMCO, AC DELCO, CARQUEST, BENDIX, AND WAGNER.  ONLY PRODUCTS THAT WERE MANUFACTURED FROM JULY 27, 2005 THROUGH JANUARY 17, 2006 (DATE CODES 0529 THROUGH 0602) ARE SUBJECT TO THIS RECALL.  WHEN SUBJECT TO VERY COLD TEMPERATURES, AN INTERNAL SEAL IN THE MASTER CYLINDER COULD LOSE FLEXIBILITY AND MAY CAUSE BRAKE FLUID TO LEAK.
recalls.notes: THIS RECALL ONLY PERTAINS TO AFTERMARKET NAPA, RAYBESTOS, AC DELCO, AIMCO, CARQUEST, AND BENDIX BRAKE HYDRAULIC MASTER CYLINDERS AND HAS NO RELATION TO ANY ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT INSTALLED ON DAIMLERCHRYSLER OR FORD VEHICLES.  CUSTOMERS MAY CONTACT THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION'S VEHICLE SAFETY HOTLINE AT 1-888-327-4236 (TTY: 1-800-424-9153); OR GO TO HTTP://WWW.SAFERCAR.GOV.

recalls.consequence: THE NUTS INCLUDED IN THE PACKAGING FOR THESE BALL JOINT ASSEMBLIES ARE MISSING THE INTENDED PREVAILING TORQUE (SELF-LOCKING) FEATURE.  IF THE INCORRECT NUT WAS TO BECOME LOOSE, THE JOINING MEMBERS MAY LOOSEN LEADING TO A SEPARATION OF THE BALL JOINT.  THIS MAY RESULT IN LOSS OF VEHICLE CONTROL, POSSIBLY RESULTING IN A VEHICLE CRASH.
recalls.remedy: FEDERAL MOGUL WILL NOTIFY OWNERS AND REPLACE THE PARTS FREE OF CHARGE.   THE RECALL BEGAN ON MAY 22, 2008.  OWNERS CAN CONTACT FEDERAL MOGUL AT 877-489-6659.
recalls.summary: FEDERAL MOGUL IS RECALLING 6,903 AFTERMARKET BALL JOINT ASSEMBLIES SHIPPED BETWEEN NOVEMBER 9, 2007 AND MARCH 26, 2008, WHICH MAY HAVE BEEN PACKAGED WITH INCORRECT NUTS.  THE PART NUMBERS PACKAGED WITH INCORRECT NUTS ARE: K7147, K7329, K8683, AND 104353.  THESE PARTS WERE MADE FOR USE ON THE VARIOUS VEHICLES LISTED ABOVE.
recalls.notes: THIS RECALL ONLY PERTAINS TO AFTERMARKET BALL JOINT ASSEMBLIES AND HAS NO RELATION TO ANY ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT INSTALLED ON VEHICLES MANUFACTURED BY THE VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS.  CUSTOMERS MAY CONTACT THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION'S VEHICLE SAFETY HOTLINE AT 1-888-327-4236 (TTY: 1-800-424-9153); OR GO TO HTTP://WWW.SAFERCAR.GOV.

recalls.consequence: THIS COULD RESULT IN A CRASH AND POSSIBLE PERSONAL INJURY.
recalls.remedy: DEALERS WILL INSPECT THESE VEHICLES.  VEHICLES THAT HAVE UNITS WITH IGNITION KEYS REMOVABLE IN GEAR POSITIONS OTHER THAN PARK, WILL HAVE THE STEERING COLUMN REPLACED.
recalls.summary: VEHICLE DESCRIPTION:  PASSENGER VEHICLES BUILT WITH AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSIONS WHICH UTILIZE A PARK/LOCK SOLENOID.    IT IS POSSIBLE TO ROTATE THE IGNITION KEY TO THE LOCK POSITION AND REMOVE THE KEY WITHOUT THE SHIFT LEVER AND TRANSMISSION BEING IN PARK.  THESE VEHICLES DO NOT COMPLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF FMVSS NO. 114, "THEFT PROTECTION."
recalls.notes: OWNER NOTIFICATION BEGAN MARCH 26, 1999.   OWNERS WHO TAKE THEIR VEHICLES TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER ON AN AGREED UPON SERVICE DATE AND DO NOT RECEIVE THE FREE REMEDY WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME SHOULD CONTACT FORD AT 1-800-392-3673.   ALSO CONTACT THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION'S AUTO SAFETY HOTLINE AT 1-888-DASH-2-DOT (1-888-327-4236).

vehicleHistory.details: Manufactured in FORD MOTOR COMPANY, MEXICO
